title: Linear Extrude + Lathe Revolution
focus: All acceptance criteria verified - implementations already existed from US-P4-006

criteria.text: Linear extrude with taper parameter produces valid mesh
criteria.notes: sdf_linear_extrude() at extrude.rs:530 with depth/taper params. SDF-based via Marching Cubes. 7 tests pass (inside/outside/taper/degenerate). generate_preview_linear_method test confirms mesh generation.

criteria.text: Lathe revolution with configurable sweep angle works
criteria.notes: lathe_mesh() at extrude.rs:578 generates mesh directly (no SDF/MC). Supports segments (6-64) and sweep (0-360 degrees). Partial sweep test confirms different vertex counts. recompute_lathe_normals() at line 687 ensures correct normals.

criteria.text: Both extrusion methods produce valid watertight meshes
criteria.notes: Both methods produce triangle meshes (indices % 3 == 0). Linear uses SDF+MC for watertight output. Lathe generates quads split into triangles with full ring wrapping for 360-degree sweep. 41 extrude tests all pass.

checklist.item: Implement linear extrude with taper parameter
Implement lathe revolution with sweep angle
Ensure both methods produce valid watertight meshes
